result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric Allen Carlson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Eric Allen Carlson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Eric Allen Carlson was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Concurrent with: with any other probationary sentence currently serving.

records.addlTxt: Pierce County DNA Proof of Submission

9:32 AM . Defendant Eric Allen Carlson in court.  Attorney Joel Schlitz in court for Eric Allen Carlson.  Attorney Kaley Walker in court for State of Wisconsin. ADA Walker: guilty to Ct#3- 3 years probation; concurrent to MN probation- court costs ($518). Dismiss Ct#1-2. Atty Schlitz and Def agree. Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant understands charges, penalties and constitutional rights  Defendant pleas guilty to Ct#3.Counsel stipulates to factual basis for plea. Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds Defendant is freely, voluntarily and knowingly making plea and waiving constitutional rights.  Court finds Defendant guilty to Ct#3, dismisses Ct#1-2. ADA Walker and Atty Schlitz address sentencing- joint recommendation for probation. Defendant addresses the court. Court orders S/W 3 years probation; concurrent to any other probationary sentence- court costs ($518) Provide DNA sample within 30 days. Comply with any programming as recommended by the COMPAS assessment and/or Department of Corrections.  0 days credit if probation is revoked. Appeal rights are given to the defendant. Defendant to report to DOC today 9:52
Plea hearing on September 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.

4:08 PM  ADA Kaley Walker in Court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Eric Allen Carlson in Court.  Attorney Barry Curtis Lundeen in Court for Eric Allen Carlson.  Court advises Defendant of charges and possible penalties.  Further reading waived.  NG pleas entered.  Bond continues.  Adjourned at 4:10 PM

4:04 PM  ADA Kaley Walker in Court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Eric Allen Carlson in Court.  Attorney Barry Curtis Lundeen in Court for Eric Allen Carlson.  Atty. Lundeen confirms that Defendant is waiving Preliminary Hearing.  Court questions Defendant.  Court finds defendant freely, intelligently and knowingly waives constitutional right to a Preliminary Hearing.  Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for further proceedings.  Attorneys request a Plea Hearing.
